text: Start with strengths: family, Country, culture, sport, music, yarning. Keep goals small and doable.
For study stress: break work into tiny steps, take short breaks, yarn with someone who backs you, try breathing or a quick walk.
For sleep: regular wind-down, less phone late at night, short breathing, avoid caffeine after lunch.
Mental health is part of overall wellbeing. Yarning and connection to Country can support feeling strong.
Cutting down on alcohol or ganja can help you feel clearer and reach your goals. You can plan small steps.
Choose tiny, realistic goals — something you can do today or this week. Celebrate small wins.
Think about who can back you up: a friend, family, Elder, coach, teacher, health worker.
Regular check-ins help track how you feel and what’s working. You can update your plan anytime.
A strong plan has 4 parts: strengths, worries, goal, support person. Simple and short is best.
Some people use ganja to relax or cope with stress. It can also make it hard to reach goals or feel well. You can yarn about what’s happening and make a small plan if you want.
If you or someone is thinking about suicide, it’s deadly important to get support. You can talk with someone you trust, use 13YARN, or get urgent help if needed.
Some people use alcohol or ganja to relax or cope. Acknowledge the feeling without promoting use. Explore what’s happening and small safer steps that fit your goals.
Keep it short, calm, and kind. Offer one or two tiny ideas, or ask one gentle question to understand more.
